"""
I see the issue - we're too far from the drill position. Let's break this down into smaller steps
and make sure we move closer to each position before placing entities.
"""

# First get more resources
move_to(nearest(Resource.IronOre))
harvest_resource(nearest(Resource.IronOre), quantity=100)

move_to(nearest(Resource.Coal))
harvest_resource(nearest(Resource.Coal), quantity=50)

# Smelt iron plates using both furnaces
print("Smelting iron plates in furnace 1...")
move_to(furnace1.position)
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace1, quantity=50)
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace1, quantity=10)

print("Smelting iron plates in furnace 2...")
move_to(furnace2.position)
insert_item(Prototype.IronOre, furnace2, quantity=50)
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, furnace2, quantity=10)

print("Waiting for smelting to complete...")
sleep(15)  # Wait longer for more plates

# Extract iron plates from furnaces
extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, furnace1.position, quantity=50)
extract_item(Prototype.IronPlate, furnace2.position, quantity=50)

# Now we should have enough plates to craft
print("Crafting components...")
craft_item(Prototype.IronGearWheel, quantity=5)  # Needed for inserters
craft_item(Prototype.TransportBelt, quantity=20)
craft_item(Prototype.BurnerInserter, quantity=2)

# Function to safely place belts with proper movement
def place_belt_line(start_pos, count, direction, belt_direction):
    """Place a line of belts, moving along with construction"""
    current = start_pos
    move_to(current)  # Start at the beginning
    
    for i in range(count):
        # Move every few belts to stay in range
        if i % 3 == 0:
            move_to(current)
            
        # Calculate next position
        if direction == "right":
            next_pos = Position(x=current.x + 1, y=current.y)
        elif direction == "down":
            next_pos = Position(x=current.x, y=current.y - 1)
        elif direction == "up":
            next_pos = Position(x=current.x, y=current.y + 1)
            
        # Place belt
        belt = place_entity(
            Prototype.TransportBelt,
            position=next_pos,
            direction=belt_direction
        )
        assert belt, f"Failed to place belt at {next_pos}"
        current = next_pos
    
    return current

# Get our key positions
drill_pos = drill.drop_position
furnace_pos = furnace1.position

print(f"Building from drill at {drill_pos} to furnace at {furnace_pos}")

# First move to drill position
move_to(drill_pos)
print("Moved to drill position")

# Place first belt under drill
first_belt_pos = Position(x=drill_pos.x, y=drill_pos.y + 1)
first_belt = place_entity(
    Prototype.TransportBelt,
    position=first_belt_pos,
    direction=Direction.RIGHT
)
assert first_belt, "Failed to place first belt"

# Build belt line in segments
current_pos = first_belt_pos

# Move right
print("Building horizontal section...")
current_pos = place_belt_line(
    current_pos,
    5,  # Number of belts
    "right",
    Direction.RIGHT
)

# Move down towards furnace
print("Building vertical section...")
current_pos = place_belt_line(
    current_pos,
    4,  # Number of belts
    "down",
    Direction.DOWN
)

# Place inserter near furnace
print("Placing inserter...")
move_to(furnace_pos)
furnace_inserter = place_entity(
    Prototype.BurnerInserter,
    position=Position(
